page.title: 02THORN FARM
page.content:
THORN FARM Thorn Farm is situated in the hamlet of Butt's Green, 5 kilometres south-east of Chelmsford. The farm is 500 years old. It is a {fruit farm growing apples and pears.} Some of the fruit is taken by articulated lorry to be sold in Doncaster in the north of England. Some of the fruit is stored locally before selling to London.
An interesting feature to be seen at Thorn Farm House is a mullioned window which was plastered up during the period of{window tax.}In 1696 houses were taxed according to the number of windows. The tax was increased on 6 occasions in the late 18th century and was not repealed until 1851. To avoid paying too much tax many people had some of their windows blocked up.
